result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler A Strausser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 1/2 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with V.L., M.M., R.R., A.V., or H.D.  Paternity to be established for new child and follow all Family Court orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including anger management and cognitive intervention counseling. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.
***AMENDED 5-16-2017: To reflect Court's Order of restitution owed.***

No expungement will be considered.

Party Address Sealed by Judge Gasiorkiewicz

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, MJM and VML (person, property, residence or family).    You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 02/16/2016: DEFENDANT MAY GO TO INTERVIEWS AS LONG AS THEY ARE VERIFIED AND APPROVED BY ZCI AND MAY ALSO ATTEND THE SUBSEQUENT EMPLOYMENT AS LONG AS ZCI IS MADE AWARE

AMENDED 05/31/2016: GPS MAY BE REMOVED.

Defendant Tyler A Strausser in court with attorney Lori Ann Kuehn.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for Rebecca Sommers for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense requests bond be modified per motion filed. The State objects to modifying bond to remove GPS - argument put on the record.

BTC: GPS may be removed. All other terms and conditions of bond remain in full force and effect. The defendant's new address may be sealed and only accessible by Court order. Any new address change must be reported to the Court within 24 hours.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
